content: The "Invest in Energy Security Act" may be cited as the Act. It pertains to the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. The "Invest in Energy Security Act" focuses on the Strategic Petroleum Reserve and amends Section 301(e)(1) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to expedite petroleum acquisition without significantly impacting consumer prices. The Secretary is required to sell 13,000,000 barrels of petroleum received under the royalty-in-kind program by September 30, 2008, and suspend acquisition for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve starting October 1, 2008. The "Invest in Energy Security Act" amends the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to expedite petroleum acquisition for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. It requires the Secretary to sell 13,000,000 barrels of petroleum by September 30, 2008, and suspend acquisition starting October 1, 2008, with the option to resume if certain conditions are met. The "Invest in Energy Security Act" amends the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to expedite petroleum acquisition for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. It requires the Secretary to sell 13,000,000 barrels of petroleum by September 30, 2008, and suspend acquisition starting October 1, 2008, with the option to resume if certain conditions are met. The Secretary shall suspend acquisition activities if the price of petroleum for the most recent 90-day period is at least 25 percent less than the 24-month historical average price, and if the resumption of Strategic Petroleum Reserve fill will not significantly impact consumer petroleum prices within the following 12-month period. The Secretary must publish revised procedures within 60 days of the enactment of the section, in line with the amendment regarding the Strategic Petroleum Reserve's fill impact on petroleum prices. SEC. 3. ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AND SECURITY FUND. The "Energy Independence and Security Fund" is established in the Treasury of the United States, administered by the Secretary of Energy. Proceeds from petroleum sales from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve are deposited in the Fund for various purposes, including transferring $100,000,000 for advanced research projects agency--energy in fiscal year 2008. In 2008, the Secretary will transfer $100,000,000 to the Energy Transformation Acceleration Fund for university-based research projects and program direction expenses. Additionally, $15,000,000 will be transferred for a program supporting the development of infrastructure for wind energy systems. For fiscal year 2008, the Secretary will transfer funds for solar energy research, wind energy infrastructure development, and low-income weatherization programs. For fiscal year 2008, the Secretary will transfer $30,000,000 for a program to accelerate research, development, and deployment of ocean and wave energy, including hydrokinetic renewable energy. For fiscal year 2008, the Secretary will transfer $110,000,000 for industrial energy efficiency research and development, and $70,000,000 for building energy efficiency research and development. For fiscal year 2008, the Secretary will transfer $30,000,000 to the account "Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy" for a program to accelerate research, development, and deployment of new technologies to improve energy efficiency and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from buildings and transportation. The Secretary will transfer $30,000,000 for geothermal research and development activities managed by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory, as authorized by the Energy Policy Act of 2005. For fiscal year 2008, the Secretary will transfer $385,000,000 to the account "Fossil Energy Research and Development" for carbon capture and storage demonstration projects, including one for the FutureGen project. In fiscal year 2008, the Secretary will transfer $50,000,000 to the "Ultra-Deepwater and Unconventional Natural Gas and Other Petroleum Research Fund" and $15,000,000 to the "Fossil Energy Research and Development" account for environmental research supporting small producers of domestic petroleum and natural gas. For fiscal year 2008, the Secretary will transfer $5,000,000 to the "Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy" account for the H-Prize Program. Amendments include changing the year in Section 999F to 2017 and updating Section 999B(e) for publication requirements. The Secretary will transfer funds to the "Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy" account for the H-Prize Program. Amendments include updating Section 999B(e) for publication requirements and management and oversight procedures for fiscal year 2008 transfers. The Secretary will prepare and publish a plan in the Federal Register for the proposed use of funds authorized in subsection (d). The plan will show how the funds will be additional to annual appropriations and include performance measures to assess the benefits. The initial plan will be published within 90 days of enactment and updated annually. The Fund transactions are exempt from apportionment under title 31, US Code. Research project proposals funded under this section should encourage the use of Other Transactions Authority. Congressional oversight is not limited, and Congress can set alternative spending limits in annual appropriations Acts. The use of Other Transactions Authority, including Technology Investment Agreements, is encouraged for commercial demonstration projects funded under this section.
